alert.note: Alert for Granville; Vance (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 2:33PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Vance and northeastern Granville Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 232 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Oxford, this storm is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rainfall leading to localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stovall, Steele Creek Marina & Campground, Tungsten, Satterwhite Point Marina and John H Kerr Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
